intro: Randia euacantha, commonly known as the slender randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with opposite, simple leaves that are often glandular-dotted. Its small, white to pink flowers are clustered in cymes, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Randia euacantha is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
